sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {2, 3, 5} and B = {3, 5, 7, 11} be two sets. Find the Cartesian product of (A Δ B) and (B Δ A), where Δ represents the symmetric difference of two sets. Show that the product is not commutative.
